about.title: About - Retro Phone Revival Project
about.intro1: All around the world, there are still countless retro phones quietly existing.
about.intro2: They come in all kinds of shapes.
about.intro3: They last for days on a single charge.
about.intro4: They offer a pure, distraction-free, offline experience — far away from social media overload.
about.intro5: But sadly, almost no one is building new apps for them anymore.
about.statement: That's why I started this project.
about.description1: I'm trying to build small, modern apps for these old devices with the help of modern tools like large language models.
about.description2: Using Java ME — the most widely supported platform across feature phones from 2005 to 2010 — these apps can run on a wide range of classic models: from Nokia's S40 and S60 series, to Sony Ericsson, Motorola, Samsung, and many others.
about.description3: I hope this project can make it a little easier for people who still love old phones to keep using them — and maybe, keep them alive a little longer.

contact.title: Contact - Retro Phone Revival Project

contact.projectDescription: The Retro Phone Revival Project is my personal long-term plan.
